intro: Diceratella psilotrichoides, commonly known as the creeping spike moss, is a small, mat-forming liverwort that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Dicranaceae and is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are often arranged in a spiral. The plant produces small, spore-bearing capsules that are typically clustered at the tips of its stems. It is typically found in temperate regions, often in rocky or forested areas with high humidity. Due to its low-growing habit and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and cryptic species.
